str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A showing, proof, demonstration, sign, token. From endeiknumi; indication.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
The act of boasting, glorying, exultation. From kauchaomai; boasting, in a good or a bad sense.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
